Abstract: This study aims to identify the most efficient and accurate machine learning models for precisely estimating the impacts of major sporting events (MSEs). To address these complex challenges, this study broadens the horizons of machine learning applications by integrating sophisticated selection techniques including Stepwise Regression, Support Vector Machines (SVMs), Boosted Neural Networks, Generalized Regression Lasso, Bootstrap Forest, and K-Nearest Neighbors (KNN). This study highlights the diverse nature of variables, including long-term investments, visitor numbers, GDP, and sporting factors such as team scores and performance, using various machine learning models to identify the most suitable models for such datasets. Document Title: Machine Learning Techniques to Assess Faceted Blue Sapphire Gemstone Prices

Author Affiliations: Department of Statistics & Computer Science, University of Kelaniya, Dalugama, Sri Lanka; Department of Statistics & Computer Science, University of Kelaniya, Dalugama, Sri Lanka; Valuation Division, National Gem & Jewellery Authority, Colombo, Sri Lanka
Publication Title: 2024 International Research Conference on Smart Computing and Systems Engineering (SCSE)
Abstract: The gem industry is a giant pillar that supports the economic growth of Sri Lanka. Gemstone market prices rely on the implicit knowledge of professional gem evaluators. Complexity in gemstone valuation due to their inherent variability leads to subjective decisions. This creates a necessity for establishing a standardized model that mitigates the risk of overpricing or underpricing of gemstones. Developing a standardized model for gemstone valuation benefits stakeholders and upholds the esteemed reputation of the gem industry. This research developed high-tech models to assess faceted blue sapphires, taking the exported gemstone records from the National Gem and Jewellery Authority. The dataset comprehends a total of 881 records with both single (409) and batch (472) assessments of faceted blue sapphire gemstones. This study identified the pivotal factors for gem valuation, such as colour, inclusions, cracks, cut, weight, state of treatment, and calibration. Multiple machine learning regression models, including multiple linear regression (MLR), quantile regression (QR), support vector regression (SVR), feedforward neural network (FFNN), and generalized regression neural network (GRNN), were employed in building pricing models. The MLR and QR models resulted in inadequate pricing models due to the violation of model assumptions. While SVR, FFNN, and GRNN exhibited similar performances, GRNN outperformed in evaluating both single and batch assessments. For pricing single assessments, the SVR model with the Gaussian kernel exhibited a superior performance. The proposed efficient and reliable pricing models to assess faceted blue sapphires will directly benefit appraisers and indirectly gem collectors and investors. This study also recommends exploring future research paths, including the integration of decision support tools like computer-trained pricing models, to assess other varieties of gemstones and enhance their broad applicability.

Abstract: Usually, only time and distance are considered when choosing a route, not the risk involved. Due to not taking the danger into account before the trip, we might have to experience numerous problems and risks. As a result, there may be dangerous situations for the driver and passengers and time and fuel wastage. Thus, the issue is how to evaluate the road while choosing the route before using it and What elements are crucial to take into account while evaluating a route’s issues. This project aims to develop a system to evaluate risk before a vehicle enters a dangerous area and predict the best path by evaluating aspects of roads including accidents, road repairs, and road blockers. Image Classification is used to detect road repairs and blockers. Federated Learning will be used to improve the accuracy of the Road blocker detector. Here, Clients will train locally using private data, send their optimized parameters to the central server, and then aggregate those trained parameters to produce a global model. Finally, Federated Learning will be used to notify users about detected incidents and event details will be marked in a Google map which is running on a Flask application. Abstract: The majority of findings and conclusions related to the application of artificial neural networks (ANNs) for time series data have been derived through non-random data-splitting procedures.
